job_description: GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES:Able to work 10-15 hours/week during the school year in the Brookings office and 40 hours per week during the summer in either the Brookings or Sioux Falls office.Fabricate, test, calibrate, and troubleshoot electronic, electro-mechanical, and mechanical components, subsystems, and systems.Complete specified projects and tasks within internship period.Position starts May, 2015.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Complete projects as assigned within internship discipline.Attend Raven University sponsored training and educational seminars.Engage and participate in Raven sponsored events.Provide periodic updates to managers and peers on assigned project status.Work closely with assigned mentor to a successful completion of internship.Complete summer end internship presentation.Learn and apply engineering techniques, policies, and procedures.Perform testing and analysis on current an future design concepts.Document testing and analysis results for review.Analyze current and new designs to improve on cost, quality, and performance.
job_requirements: KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Junior or senior level standing in Electrical Engineering.Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously without close supervision.Ability to work with high level of confidentiality.Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.Ability to use a computer and software as defined necessary for the internship.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with team members.WORKING CONDITIONS:Mostly indoors in an office environment although some outdoor work may be required.REPORTING RELATIONSHIP:Position reports to Brookings Engineering Manager for internship, with accountability to intern mentor.Subordinate Staff:   NoneEOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityOpen To All Majors:No
